citation.article-title: Description of Paenisporosarcina quisquiliarum gen. nov., sp. nov., and reclassification of Sporosarcina macmurdoensis Reddy et al. 2003 as Paenisporosarcina macmurdoensis comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Paenisporosarcina (Pae′ni.spo′ro.sar.ci′na. L. adv. paeni almost; N.L. fem. n. Sporosarcina a bacterial genus name; N.L. fem. n. Paenisporosarcina almost a Sporosarcina, because it is closely related to this genus but is phylogenetically distinct).
Cells are Gram-positive rods and/or cocci, strictly aerobic, non-motile and form round endospores in a terminal or subterminal position and are catalase-positive.
The major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 1ω7c alcohol.
MK-7 and/or MK-8 are the major menaquinones.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan is of the A4α type with an interpeptide bridge l-Lys–d-Asp.
The polar lipid profile consists of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, an aminophospholipid (APL1), an aminolipid (AL1) and an unknown lipid (UL4).
The G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 46.0 mol%.
The type species is Paenisporosarcina quisquiliarum.
